for no reason? wtf...

message: [#202] New Variant to Test Ads Specifically

title: [#202] Interstitials Work...
message:
[#202] Interstitials Work...

But they're an ugly implementation. StrictMode causes ANRs and even
without StrictMode enabled, loading the Ad has to happen in a
postDelayed Runnable to prevent another ANR. It's gross.

title: [#200] AdMob Constants Imported
message:
[#200] AdMob Constants Imported

- Updated the `google-services.json` file for AdMob integration
- Added AdMob constants

title: [#202] ProGuard Enabled
message:
[#202] ProGuard Enabled

- TL;DR: I officially hit the Multidex 64k method limit.
- I finally went in and did the ugly work of making Quotograph
ProGuard-enabled
- Debug builds now minify imports to avoid the limit
- We lost FishBun along the way in an attempt to reduce dependencies
(image picking now limited to single images on <v18)
- In good news, shrinking reduced APK size by approx. 30% (without
resource shrinking enabled)

message:

# Conflicts:

#	LiveWallpaperQuotes/app/src/main/java/com/stanleyidesis/quotograph/api/drawing/LWQDrawScript.java

title: [#172] Fixes Bad Line-Breaks
message:
[#172] Fixes Bad Line-Breaks

Turns out, we can't use StaticLayout.Builder yet because it's only
available in v23.
Back to the drawing board! We get the ending index of each word in the
quote and compare those indeces to the last visible character offset in
the StaticLayout. We shrink the font until each line ends on a known
word. Yah!

title: Merge pull request #206 from stanidesis/180-test-strict-mode
message:
Merge pull request #206 from stanidesis/180-test-strict-mode

Fixes #180

title: [#180] Caught a Logical Error
message: [#180] Caught a Logical Error

title: [#180] Switched to StackBlurring
message:
[#180] Switched to StackBlurring

As of this commit, Quotograph will default to a blurring algorithm by
Mario Klingemann. This script does not rely on the RenderScript package,
works incredibly fast and with limited memory overhead. It appears to be
an ideal solution.

This also happens to bypass the StrictMode error caused by the
RenderScript packages.

title: [#180] A lot of Progress with StrictMode On
message: [#180] A lot of Progress with StrictMode On

- This is a bummer, shrinkResources is disabled and I had to remove a
lint check because Android Studio is now incompatible with the
auto-generated ButterKnife files

Not going to do the rest of the work on this issue, instead going to
break it out piecemeal.

* User Survey (#195)

It has a remote config now with a survey experiment set up properly. The
settings activity pulls the config down and can use the result to choose
how to display the survey.

- Debug Dialog exists!
- Survey notification is live and functional
- We're pulling from RemoteConfig on all fronts

* [#190] Missed a Spot

- The TimerTask is tested and working, using the delay from the config
- The interval is also taken into account, waiting the appropriate time
before resurfacing the survey

* [#190] Popup Works

- Still needs opening and exiting animations
- Need to hook it into the survey manager

* [#190] The Popup is Ready

- It fades in and out
- It looks good
- Tested on debug and through the natural survey process

* [#190] In-Playlist Survey is Go

- This was tricky, frikkin RecyclerView
- Works!
- Pretty :dancer:

* [#190] Fixes requested by...me

* Quick Fix

* Firebase Analytics (#196)

* [#189] Mega Commit

- Analytics for almost everything
- Improved tooltip flow
- Improved add process (goes straight to search and includes keyboard)

- I messed up the Tag situation
- Also fixed the DebuggableActivity, whoops...

- We can see when a paste, cut, or copy occurs
- Also improved the editing and searching hints

* [#189] Tracking Double Tap to Launch

- Fixed a Class Cast Exception

* [#189] Fixed Another Potential Crash

* [#189] Consolidated Some Code

I think it's finally ready

* Removed Analytics Activity

- Consolidated search across events and FA tracking

message: [#79] Icon is ready

title: [#79] A lot of little fixer uppers
message:
[#79] A lot of little fixer uppers

- Receivers and Services disabled by default
- Component enabling/disabling merged into LWQApplication
- Removed network check when retrieving active wallpaper (should be
cached anyway)
- New WallpaperEvent state: RENDERED_WALLPAPER
- LWQUpdateService now makes up to 3 attempts before giving up on
refreshing the wallpaper
- LWQWallpaperService notifies application when rendering completes
using WALLPAPER_RENDERED
- Improved animations and event handling in LWQSettingsActivity
- Removed SurfaceView from LWQWallpaperActivity, simplified it immensely

title: [#72] A lot of overhaul data-wise
message:
[#72] A lot of overhaul data-wise

Playlist objects exist, as well as join tables (PlaylistAuthor,
PlaylistCategory, etc.) This future-proofs the table structure to allow
multiple playlists and unlimited categories/authors/quotes attached to
one or more playlists.

Removes autopilot mode entirely, as well as the quote category
selection dropdown.

There’s now a Queue that manages UI state changes, this is probably my
best implementation of a multi-state UI that manages to behave
consistently and protects against monkeys.

title: Merge pull request #63 from stanidesis/56-optimize-callbacks-with-eventbus
message:
Merge pull request #63 from stanidesis/56-optimize-callbacks-with-eventbus

[Closes #56] Switched to EventBus by GreenDAO

title: [#56] Switched to EventBus by GreenDAO
message:
[#56] Switched to EventBus by GreenDAO

This optimized a lot of clogs in the pipes:

- Asynchronous listeners now update surfaces when a new wallpaper
appears
- Notifications handled within the LWQNotificationController thanks to
asynch events
- Preference updates automatically reflected on all drawn surfaces
- Significantly reduced code clutter resulting from callbacks
- Simplified the wallpaper controller
- And more!

title: [#16] Activate and Settings activities created
message:
[#16] Activate and Settings activities created

They inherit from an LWQWallpaperActivity that renders and fades the
sample wallpaper background. Launching correctly checks for an existing
wallpaper match and responds appropriately.

title: [#16] Fixes a drawing race condition
message:
[#16] Fixes a drawing race condition

The SurfaceHolder was changing asynchronously, mid-draw script. That
was causing a lock/release bug

title: [#16] Fixed a cache eviction bug
message:
[#16] Fixed a cache eviction bug

Evicting from cache evicted the image from memory and from disk. We’ll
let the disk build and possibly evict images in the future based on an
LRU system

title: [#16] Settings activity exists, renders the wallpaper behind it
message:
[#16] Settings activity exists, renders the wallpaper behind it

Lots of updates here, overly large commit unfortunately. This adds some
user interface, refactored the API a bit to support on demand wallpaper
generation, included a broadcast for active wallpaper completion as
well so that on first launch, the activity can wait for the initial
task to complete.

[#2] Changed alarm trigger date

[#2] Established an updater service and alarms

wallpaper every 24 hours by default (inexact)
